data.title: The referee once dismissed Duy Manh to officiate the match between Vietnam and Japan
data.meta_description: Identity of the referee team controlling the second leg between Japan and Vietnam in the third qualifying round World Cup 2022 Asia region has just been announced by the tournament organizing committee The Uzbek talent will be on duty at the final match of this tournament on March 29. The referee will be Tantashev Ilgiz. [...]
data.text:
Identity of the referee team controlling the second leg between Japan and Vietnam in the third qualifying round World Cup 2022 Asia region has just been announced by the tournament organizing committee The Uzbek talent will be on duty at the final match of this tournament on March 29.

The referee will be Tantashev Ilgiz. Mr. Ilgiz’s two assistants will be Tsapenko Andrey and Gaynullin Timur. The fourth referee is Mr. Riskullaev Akhrol. In charge of the VAR room is the Qatari referee: Abdulla Ali Al Athba.

Referee Tantashev Ilgiz is not too strange to the fans of the club. Vietnam team. He was the main referee of the first leg between Saudi Arabia and Vietnam in September 2021.

In that match, the Uzebekistan ‘King in Black’ disqualified Do Duy Manh. He gave 2 yellow cards to Vietnam team in just 5 minutes ( from minute 49′ to minute 54′).

Notable in the second yellow card situation when it was said that Duy Manh intentionally used his hand to play the ball in the penalty area of ​​Vietnam national team. suffered a penalty and caused the coach and his team to Park Hang Seo lost in the end with a score of 1-3.

Before disqualifying Duy Manh, referee Tantashev Ilgiz also issued a yellow card to Vu Van Thanh. Meanwhile, he did not draw any penalty cards for Saudi Arabia.

Mr. Tantashev Ilgiz is 37 years old and has become a FIFA-level referee since 2015. Although he is an Uzbek national, the referee This guy is on duty in Saudi Arabia. According to the assessment of the International Arbitration Council, Tantashev Ilgiz is the most strict ‘controller’ in Asia at the present time.

The second leg between Japan and Vietnam took place at 5:35 p.m. on March 29 Vietnam time at Saitama Stadium (Tokyo Japan).

Meanwhile, 5 days before the Japan vs. Vietnam match, the Vietnamese team will welcome the Oman team at My Dinh Stadium. The identity of the referee team controlling this match was also determined as they were on duty in the second leg of the third qualifying round of the 2022 World Cup between Vietnam and Saudi Arabia on November 16, 2021.

That is the main referee Hattab Hanna (Syria) the first assistant is referee Ahmad Ali (Syria) the second assistant is UAE referee Ahmed Saeed Ahmed Alasil and the goal referee is Mr. Qasim Eesee (Iraq ). The only referee in charge of the VAR room is from Southeast Asia, specifically Thailand, but is also a familiar name to Vietnamese football fans: referee Sivakorn Pu Udom. VAR assistant referee is Mr. Al Qaysi (Iraq).

“
